data.title: Bitmine added 112,960 ETH this week, worth $443 million.
data.description: According to EmberCN monitoring, Bitmine, the largest holder of Ethereum, received 7,660 ETH from Galaxy Digital 6 hours ago, worth $29.28 million. This week, Bitmine has increased its holdings by 112,960 ETH through BitGo, FalconX, Kraken, and Galaxy Digital, worth $443 million, at an average price of approximately $3,923.

data.title: Crypto stocks closed higher across the board in the US market, with ALTS rising 9.57%.
data.description: According to data from msx.com, at the close of trading on the US stock market, the Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 0.09%, the S&P 500 rose 0.26%, and the Nasdaq Composite rose 0.61%. Cryptocurrency stocks generally rose, with ALTS up 9.57%, SBET up 8.38%, MSTR up 5.87%, and BMNR up 4.71%. msx.com is a decentralized RWA trading platform that has listed hundreds of RWA tokens, covering US stock and ETF tokens such as AAPL, AMZN, GOOGL, META, MSFT, NFLX, and NVDA.

data.title: Bitwise Updates XRP ETF Application with Key Details
data.description: According to Odaily, Bloomberg ETF analyst Eric Balchunas shared on the X platform that Bitwise has submitted the fourth revision of its XRP ETF application. This update includes information about the exchange, the New York Stock Exchange, and a management fee rate of 0.34%. Eric Balchunas noted that this step is typically one of the final stages in the application process.

data.title: Bloomberg: Coinbase plans to acquire BVNK for $2 billion to boost its new stablecoin business.
data.description: Sources familiar with the matter revealed that US cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase Global Inc. is in late-stage acquisition talks with stablecoin infrastructure startup BVNK, with a proposed transaction valued at approximately $2 billion, pending due diligence. Coinbase Ventures, Coinbase's venture capital arm, is one of BVNK's investors, and the deal is expected to close later this year or early next year. If the transaction is completed, Coinbase's revenue streams will no longer rely solely on transaction fees, and stablecoin usage will increase. (Bloomberg)

data.title: "A whale that won 14 times with large-scale openings" has suffered a floating loss of over $7 million on its long positions.
data.description: According to on-chain analyst Yu Jin, the "whale with 14 consecutive wins in large-scale openings" is still holding onto its positions, having made no trades in the past day or so. This whale currently holds long positions worth $367 million, with a current unrealized loss of $7.27 million.

data.title: Bitwise has updated its XRP ETF filing, adding information on the NYSE and a 0.34% management fee.
data.description: Bloomberg ETF analyst Eric Balchunas wrote on the X platform that Bitwise has updated its XRP ETF application documents for the fourth time. This revision adds information about the exchange (New York Stock Exchange) and a 0.34% management fee. Balchunas stated that this is typically one of the final steps in the application process.

data.title: Whale Investor Maintains Position Despite Losses
data.description: According to Odaily, blockchain analyst Yu Jin reports that the 'large-scale position whale,' known for winning 14 consecutive trades, has not made any moves in the past day. The whale currently holds a long position valued at $367 million, with an unrealized loss of $7.27 million.

data.title: James Wynn increased his short position in Bitcoin to 8.27 BTC, with a floating profit of $15,000.
data.description: According to Onchain Lens monitoring, James Wynn further increased his short position in Bitcoin (40x), reaching 8.27 Bitcoins, worth $900,000, with a floating profit of approximately $15,000.

data.title: A U.S. appeals court ruled that crypto bank Custodia has no right to force the Federal Reserve to grant access to its master account.
data.description: The U.S. Tenth Circuit Court of Appeals ruled that Wyoming-based crypto bank Custodia had no right to compel the Federal Reserve to grant it access to a master account, upholding an unfavorable ruling by a lower court last year. Custodia sued the Federal Reserve in 2022, initially claiming the Fed's assessment of its master account application was too time-consuming, but later amended its lawsuit after the Fed rejected its application. Custodia argued that the Fed had no right to reject master account applications. Last year, a federal judge dismissed Custodia's lawsuit, ruling that the Fed was not obligated to grant master accounts to every eligible depository institution. The company subsequently appealed, and a panel of three judges heard arguments from both sides in January of this year. (Coindesk)

data.title: Fed's Bostic: A December rate cut is not a certainty
data.description: Federal Reserve Chairman Rafael Bostic stated that a December rate cut is not a given. Speaking at the Dallas Fed meeting about the monetary policy outlook, he emphasized: "I want to reiterate that every meeting is a live decision-making process; we neither pre-determine a course nor deviate from the principle of data-driven decision-making." Bostic specifically pointed out that although the market has strong expectations for a rate cut at the end of the year, it is wise for Fed Chairman Jerome Powell to clearly state after this week's policy meeting that a December rate cut is not a certainty. He stated, "The dot plot figures indicate different opinions, but we shouldn't overinterpret them. We will rely on the data to ensure appropriate decision-making." (Jinshi)
